attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Our country is often referred to as ‘UK plc’.  If it was a plc, it would not be 'ruled', but 'managed': by a Chief Executive and a Board of Directors, answerable to shareholders at an AGM. The UK’s Ruler, HM Queen Elizabeth II, has delegated to ‘Government’ the management of the country for the benefit of its citizens -  ‘shareholders’. All shareholders want is that their investment , in taxes, is managed to provide security, health-care, education and pension, but ‘AGMs’ only occur every four years and no opportunity exists to express a view between them.  Nor can citizens vote for what they really want at the appointed time - only select between extremes.  Since ‘Government’ is now synonymous with ‘Ruling’, citizens suffer ‘elected dictatorship’, with unwanted and unpopular laws, taxes and policies imposed by a largely unaccountable Government and a wholly unanswerable Civil Service. To focus the minds of public servants, the word ‘Government’ should be replaced by ‘Management’, to remind them that their role is to enable the electorate’s wishes, not to impose views upon them.
